marketNews.title: IHSG down -0.67%, SIDO Plans Share Buyback up to IDR 300 M. News Compilation for Today.
marketNews.content: IHSG closed down -0.67%. SIDO plans a share buyback up to IDR 300 M. News compilation for today. March 17, 2025. The Chairman of the Daily Board of Gerindra Party, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, stated that President Prabowo Subianto currently has no plans to reshuffle the cabinet in the near future, including for the finance minister position currently held by Sri Mulyani. Previously, Sri Mulyani was rumored to resign from her position. Sri Mulyani herself declined to comment on this issue. The consensus of economists compiled by Reuters expects Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate at 5.75% in the Board of Governors Meeting on Wednesday (19/3) to protect the rupiah exchange rate from further depreciation amid the escalation of the global trade war. BPS noted that Indonesia's trade balance surplus rose to USD 3.12 billion in February 2025 (vs. Feb 2024: surplus USD 833 million, Jan 2025: surplus USD 3.45 billion), exceeding the consensus expectation of USD 2.45 billion. This result was driven by export growth of +14.05% YoY (vs. Jan 2025: +4.68% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation (+9.1% YoY) and marking the highest growth since January 2023. Meanwhile, imports only grew by +2.3% YoY (vs. Jan 2025: -2.73% YoY, expectation: +0.6% YoY). The Ministry of ESDM set the Reference Coal Price (HBA) at USD 117.76 per ton for the second period of March 2025, a decrease of -8.2% from the first period of March 2025 at USD 128.24 per ton. HBA itself has been set as the reference price for exports per March 1, 2025, with the HBA determination revised to 2 times a month. Previously, the implementation of HBA as an export reference price was predicted to suppress demand from China, considering HBA has a relatively higher price compared to the price reference generally used in global coal trading. The Minister of Transportation, Dudy Purwagandhi, stated that the government will still impose operational restrictions on freight transport from March 24-April 8, 2025, even though truck operators are threatening massive protests. Dudy mentioned that the restriction on trucks during this period is intended so that the public can avoid congestion during the Eid homecoming. The Chairman of the Central Executive Board of the Indonesian Truck Entrepreneurs Association, Gemilang Tarigan, said that freight transport entrepreneurs agree not to operate on March 20, 2025, if the government does not revise the prohibition period.

tickerNews.title: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) 2M25: Net Profit +8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded net profit (bank only) of 4.2 trillion rupiah in February 2025 (+12% YoY, -10% MoM). This result caused the net profit for 2M25 to grow by +8.4% YoY to 9 trillion rupiah, better than the 2025 consolidated estimate from the consensus which predicted a growth of +7% YoY. On the positive side, BBCA recorded a decrease in credit cost (CoC) in February 2025. On the other hand, liquidity is getting tighter and Net Interest Margin (NIM) is comparatively low. CoC bank only decreased to 0.05% in February 2025 (vs. January 2025: 0.76%, February 2024: 0.57%). This recovery caused CoC throughout 2M25 to fall to the level of 0.4% (vs. 2M24: 0.43%), still higher than the 2025 consolidated guidance from management which targets 0.3%. BBCA bank only credit growth throughout 2M25 slowed down to +14% YoY (vs. 1M25: +15.1% YoY, 2M24: +15.1% YoY). This slowdown is in line with management's intention to target consolidated credit growth during 2025 in the range of +6-8% YoY. Meanwhile, Third Party Fund (DPK) growth remained stagnant at +3.9% YoY in 2M25 (vs. 1M25: +3.9% YoY, 2M24: +5.1% YoY). This dynamic caused the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) to breach the 80% level again, standing at 80.6% in 2M25 (vs. 1M25: 79.7%, 2M24: 73.5%). Although liquidity tightening (rising LDR) is an industry-wide problem, BBCA still has relatively good liquidity compared to other 'Big 4 Banks'. NIM bank only stood at 5.4% in February 2025 (vs. February 2024: 5.33%, January 2025: 5.91%), marking the lowest level since February 2024. This result caused NIM throughout 2M25 to be at 5.67% (vs. 2M24: 5.52%), slightly below the 2025 consolidated guidance from management in the range of 5.7-5.8%. The relatively low growth in interest income of 7.1 trillion rupiah (+4.8% YoY, -7.6% MoM) was the main factor for the low NIM in February 2025. For comparison, annual interest income growth was in the range of +7-8% YoY in October-December (4Q24). Nevertheless, Net Interest Income (NII) still managed to grow slightly better, reaching +6% YoY in February 2025 and 2M25, driven by low interest expenses kept in check. An increase in loan yield itself is one of BBCA management's intentions this year. Pre-provision Operating Profit (PPOP) grew +8.6% YoY during 2M25, supported by relatively efficient operating expenses (opex) with a more moderate growth of +3.5% YoY. We assess BBCA's bank only performance in February 2025 as a mixed performance because CoC successfully decreased, but the company recorded a low NIM. Nevertheless, we assess that NIM has the potential to recover in the future driven by several factors: 1) prospect of interest rate cuts; and 2) slowdown in credit growth - in line with guidance - which can impact loan yield improvement from changes in loan mix.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Plans Share Buyback up to IDR 300 Billion
tickerNews.content: SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul plans to conduct a buyback of approximately 450 million (1.5%) shares with a fund allocation of up to 300 billion rupiah. The maximum buyback price is capped at 760 rupiah per share, while the buyback period will last until May 2, 2026. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 2, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTRO: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Increased Stake in Petrosea
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 105.2 million shares of Petrosea at an average price of 2,947 rupiah per share on March 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 310 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 42.476% to 43.519%.

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific Targets Revenue Growth up to 4x in 2025 Driven by SECP Acquisition
tickerNews.content: The Director of Chandra Asri Pacific, Edi Rivai, stated that the company targets revenue growth up to 4x times during 2025, driven by the contribution of the Shell Energy and Chemicals Park (SECP) in Singapore which is currently in the final stages of acquisition. Edi explained that this target assumes the SECP acquisition will be completed in 2Q25. Edi also mentioned that the company has allocated capex of 8.8 trillion rupiah during 2025 to commence construction of the chlor alkali-ethylene dichloride (CA-EDC) plant, valued at a total of 15 trillion rupiah. This plant, which has been designated as a national strategic project (PSN), will produce over 400,000 tons of caustic soda (sodium hydroxide) per year and 500,000 tons of ethylene dichloride.

tickerNews.title: INDY: Indika Energy plans to participate as a cornerstone investor in Nanshan Aluminium IPO
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy through its subsidiary, PT Perkasa Investama Mineral, plans to participate as a cornerstone investor worth US$10 million in the IPO of Nanshan Aluminium International Holdings Limited on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. INDY stated that this step is in line with the company's objective to reduce dependence on coal-related activities.

tickerNews.title: AVIA: Avia Avian Increases Selling Price by 1% to 2% Due to Rupiah Weakness
tickerNews.content: Head of Investor Relations Avia Avian, Andreas Timothy Hadikrisno, stated that the company has increased its selling price by about +1-2% early this year. This step was taken because the rupiah exchange rate continues to weaken, while around 70% of raw materials are imported products. Andreas mentioned that they are optimistic that this selling price increase will not erode market share because the company had already informed the plan for the selling price increase in early 2025. Previously, AVIA announced a revenue growth target of about +6-10% YoY throughout 2025.

tickerNews.title: PBID: Panca Budi Idaman Records Net Profit of IDR 101 Billion in 4Q24 (+30% YoY in 2024)
tickerNews.content: Panca Budi Idaman recorded a net profit of 101 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-14% YoY, -23% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 reaching 485 billion rupiah (+30% YoY). Although revenue in 4Q24 successfully grew by +13% YoY, the cost of revenue (+15% YoY) and operating expenses (+34% YoY) surged, causing the operating profit margin to drop to 8.7% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 11.7%). The surge in operating expenses in 4Q24 was caused by an increase in total salary and allowance costs by +39% YoY. Throughout 2024, revenue grew by +12% YoY, while the cost of revenue (+9% YoY) and operating expenses (+13% YoY) grew more moderately, thus improving all company profit margins. Looking ahead, PBID targets revenue growth of +10% YoY throughout 2025.

tickerNews.title: NSSS: CEO Teguh Patriawan Increased Stake in Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera, Teguh Patriawan, purchased approximately 46.6 million NSSS shares at a price of 240 rupiah per share on March 12, 2025. The total value of the transaction reached approximately 11.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Teguh Patriawan's ownership in NSSS increased from 10.485% to 10.681%.

tickerNews.title: NINE: Techno9 Indonesia Plans Rights Issue with up to 50% Dilution for Working Capital
tickerNews.content: Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) plans to hold a rights issue of up to ~2.2 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 50%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the fund acquisition will be used for working capital. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on April 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TAXI: Express Transindo Utama Resumes Taxi Operations in Jabodetabek with Electric Fleet
tickerNews.content: Kontan reports that Express Transindo Utama (TAXI) has resumed its taxi services in the Jabodetabek area, after the company temporarily halted conventional taxi operations post-pandemic. The resumption of TAXI operations is supported by a strategic partnership with PT Rekan Anak Bangsa, a subsidiary of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO), established since November 2024. Through this partnership, drivers without vehicles can operate using TAXI's electric fleet via the Gocar application. In December 2024, TAXI began serving the public again with a BYD M6 electric car fleet. The CEO of TAXI, Johannes Triatmojo, stated that the company targets at least 24,000 conventional and online taxi fleets to operate in Jabodetabek.
